00042 class ImmovableTrimesh : public SimpleTrimeshTwo{
00043 public:
00044 
00045   ImmovableTrimesh(const std::string fname, 
00046                    const my_float_t max_pt2surf_dist = 1.5) 
00047     : SimpleTrimeshTwo(fname)
00048   {
00049     if(!read_face_file(fname, true, true)){
00050       set_fail_flag();
00051       return;
00052     }
00053 
00054     A_max_pt2surf_dist = max_pt2surf_dist;
00055     const my_float_t bin_width = 2.0;
00056     const my_float_t max_pt2pt_dist = 
00057       sqrt(max_dist_to_centroid() * max_dist_to_centroid() + 
00058            max_pt2surf_dist*max_pt2surf_dist);
00059     A_grid.setup_grid(vertices_begin(), number_of_vertices(), bin_width, 
00060                       max_pt2pt_dist);
00061   }
00062 
00063   ~ImmovableTrimesh()
00064   {
00065   
00066   }
00067 
00069   bool
00070   closest_point(const my_float_t *pt, my_float_t *dist, my_float_t *cp,
00071                 const my_float_t max_dist = 1.5) const
00072   {
00073     *dist = my_float_max;
00074     std::fill(cp, cp + 3, my_float_max);
00075 
00076     if(max_dist > A_max_pt2surf_dist){
00077       std::cerr << "ImmovableTrimesh::closest_point requires a max point to "
00078                 << "surface distance <= " << A_max_pt2surf_dist << " (A)\n";
00079       return false;
00080     }
00081     const my_float_t max_pt2pt_sq_dist = 
00082       max_dist_to_centroid() * max_dist_to_centroid() + max_dist*max_dist;
00083 
00084     DistanceArray::bin_vci bin_iter = A_grid.get_bin(pt); 
00085     if(bin_iter == A_grid.bins_end()) return false;
00086 
00087     // For each point (vertex) in the bin:
00088     //   if(dist(vertex, pt) <= max_pt2pt_dist)
00089     //     keep all triangles containing vertex
00090     //     uniquify using triangle index
00091 
00092     // Find all of the triangles we need to test
00093     std::map<int, bool> have_triangle;
00094     std::vector<const my_float_t*>::const_iterator vert = bin_iter->begin();
00095 //    for( ; vert < bin_iter->end() && !close_enough; ++vert){
00096     for( ; vert < bin_iter->end(); ++vert){
00097       if(dist_squared(pt, *vert) > max_pt2pt_sq_dist) continue;
00098 
00099       // Look up the triangles for current vertex using the vertex's index
00100       int vert_idx = (*vert - vertices_begin()) / 3;
00101       const dir_point_storage<two_thirds_triangle>& vert_tris = 
00102         get_vert_triangles(vert_idx);
00103 
00104       const my_float_t *c_vert = *vert;
00105       dir_point_storage<two_thirds_triangle>::const_iterator delta;
00106       for(delta = vert_tris.begin(); delta != vert_tris.end(); delta += 2){
00107         if(have_triangle.find(delta->triangle_index) != have_triangle.end())
00108           continue;
00109 
00110         // No need to save triangles -- just compute closest point
00111         have_triangle[delta->triangle_index] = true;
00112         SimpleTrimeshTwo::compute_close_point(pt, c_vert, delta->pos, 
00113                                               (delta + 1)->pos, *dist, dist, cp);
00114 //        if(-1.0*dist_tol < *dist && *dist < dist_tol){
00115 //          close_enough = true;
00116 //          break;
00117 //        }
00118       }
00119     }
00120     return true;
00121   }

00127   bool
00128   compare(const my_float_t *other_vert_begin, const uint num_other_vert,
00129           my_float_t *closest_pts, my_float_t *dists,
00130           const my_float_t *other_normals_begin = 0, 
00131           my_float_t *best_Ns = 0, my_float_t *N_dists = 0,
00132           const my_float_t max_dist = 1.5) const
00133   {
00134 //    std::cout << "\n\nTime to compare surfaces\n";
00135     std::fill(dists, dists + num_other_vert, my_float_max);
00136     std::fill(closest_pts, closest_pts + 3*num_other_vert, my_float_max);
00137     if(other_normals_begin && best_Ns && N_dists){
00138       std::fill(best_Ns, best_Ns + 3*num_other_vert,
00139                 my_float_max);
00140       std::fill(N_dists, N_dists + num_other_vert, my_float_max);
00141     }
00142 
00143     if(max_dist > A_max_pt2surf_dist){
00144       std::cerr << "ImmovableTrimesh::compare requires a max point to "
00145                 << "surface distance <= " << A_max_pt2surf_dist << " (A)\n";
00146       return false;
00147     }
00148 
00149     // It is relatively easy to show that an upper bound on a vertex from the
00150     // other surface to this mesh is given by the sqrt of the square of the 
00151     // maximum allowed distance + the square of the maximum distance from
00152     // the centroid of any triangle to its vertex farthest away from the
00153     // centroid
00154     const my_float_t max_pt2pt_sq_dist =
00155       max_dist_to_centroid() * max_dist_to_centroid() + max_dist*max_dist;
00156 
00157     // Get all the bins that contain at least one vertex from the other surface
00158     DistanceArray::bin2vert_mmap b2v_map;
00159     A_grid.get_bins(other_vert_begin, num_other_vert, &b2v_map);
00160 
00161     DistanceArray::bin2vert_mmci b2v_iter;
00162     for(b2v_iter = b2v_map.begin(); b2v_iter != b2v_map.end(); ++b2v_iter){
00163       if(b2v_iter->first == A_grid.bins_end()) break;
00164  
00165       const my_float_t *other_vert = b2v_iter->second; 
00166       const size_t other_vert_idx = (other_vert - other_vert_begin) / 3;
00167       my_float_t *curr_dist = &dists[other_vert_idx];
00168       my_float_t *curr_cp = &closest_pts[3*other_vert_idx];
00169 
00170 #if 0
00171       std::cout.precision(6);
00172       std::cout << "vert idx: " << other_vert_idx << "\n";
00173       std::cout << "finding closest point for the vertex " 
00174                 << other_vert[0] << " "
00175                 << other_vert[1] << " "
00176                 << other_vert[2] << "\n";
00177 #endif
00178 
00179       // Find all of the triangles we need to test
00180       std::map<int, bool> have_triangle;
00181       std::vector<const my_float_t*>::const_iterator self_vert = 
00182         b2v_iter->first->begin();
00183       for( ; self_vert < b2v_iter->first->end(); ++self_vert){
00184         if(dist_squared(other_vert, *self_vert) > max_pt2pt_sq_dist) continue;
00185 
00186         // Look up the triangles for current vertex using the vertex's index
00187         int self_vert_idx = (*self_vert - vertices_begin()) / 3;
00188         const dir_point_storage<two_thirds_triangle>& vert_tris =
00189           get_vert_triangles(self_vert_idx);
00190     
00191         const my_float_t *c_vert = *self_vert;
00192         dir_point_storage<two_thirds_triangle>::const_iterator delta;
00193         for(delta = vert_tris.begin(); delta != vert_tris.end(); delta += 2){
00194           if(have_triangle.find(delta->triangle_index) != have_triangle.end())
00195             continue;
00196 
00197           // No need to save triangles -- just compute closest point
00198           have_triangle[delta->triangle_index] = true;
00199 
00200           if(other_normals_begin && best_Ns && N_dists){
00201             compute_close_point(other_vert, 
00202                                 other_normals_begin + 3*other_vert_idx,
00203                                 c_vert, 
00204                                 normals_begin() + (c_vert - vertices_begin()),
00205                                 *delta, *(delta + 1), curr_dist, curr_cp,
00206                                 N_dists + other_vert_idx,
00207                                 best_Ns + 3*other_vert_idx);
00208 
00209 
00210           }else
00211             SimpleTrimeshTwo::compute_close_point(other_vert, c_vert, 
00212                                                   delta->pos, (delta + 1)->pos,
00213                                                   *curr_dist, curr_dist, curr_cp);
00214 #if 0
00215           std::cout << "current best cp: " 
00216                     << curr_cp[0] << " "
00217                     << curr_cp[1] << " "
00218                     << curr_cp[2] << "\n";
00219           std::cout << "current best dist: " << *curr_dist << "\n\n";
00220 #endif
00221 //        if(-1.0*dist_tol < *dist && *dist < dist_tol){
00222 //          close_enough = true;
00223 //          break;
00224 //        }
00225         }
00226       }
00227 //      ++curr_dist;
00228 //      curr_cp += 3;
00229     }
00230     return true;
00231   }

00233   const dir_point_storage<two_thirds_triangle>&
00234   get_vert_triangles(const int vert_idx) const
00235   { return A_triangles_mess[vert_idx]; }

00280 private:
00281 
00282   void 
00283   init()

00285 
00286   void
00287   compute_close_point(const my_float_t *pt, const my_float_t *N_in, 
00288                       const my_float_t *v0, const my_float_t *n0, 
00289                       const two_thirds_triangle &delta1, 
00290                       const two_thirds_triangle &delta2, my_float_t *best_d, 
00291                       my_float_t *closest_pt, my_float_t *best_N_dist,
00292                       my_float_t *computed_N) const
00293   {
00294     my_float_t d = my_float_max;
00295 //    my_float_t N_d = my_float_max;
00296     my_float_t cp[3];
00297     std::fill(cp, cp+3, my_float_max);
00298   
00299     // Check if projection of pt to face plane is contained in the face
00300     // NOTE: this assumes that best_d holds the previous best distance
00301     bool rv = corresponding_point(pt, v0, 
00302                                   static_cast<const my_float_t*>(delta1.pos), 
00303                                   static_cast<const my_float_t*>(delta2.pos), 
00304                                   *best_d, &d, cp);
00305     if(rv){
00306       bool pos_was_updated = update_closest_pt(best_d, closest_pt, d, cp);
00307 
00308       // Need to think about how we wish to approach this and with what
00309       // accuracy
00310       // Compute normals -- try average for first 
00311 
00312       // if normals are more than 90 degrees off we may wish to drop
00313       // corresponding point -- for now we just assume closest point is best
00314       // and sum of normals will tell us otherwise
00315       if(pos_was_updated && best_N_dist && computed_N){
00316         my_float_t N_avg[3];
00317         std::copy(n0, n0 + 3, N_avg);
00318         my_axpy(3, 1.0, delta1.dir, 1, N_avg, 1);
00319         my_axpy(3, 1.0, delta2.dir, 1, N_avg, 1);
00320         normalize(N_avg);
00321         
00322         // compute 1/2 L2 norm
00323         // It is easy to see that if the two vectors U & V have unit length
00324         // the L2 norm is 2(1 - dot(U,V))
00325         *best_N_dist = 1 - dot(N_avg, N_in);
00326          
00327         std::copy(N_avg, N_avg + 3, computed_N); 
00328       }
00329       
00330     }else{ 
00331       const my_float_t *V[] = { v0, delta1.pos, delta2.pos};
00332       const my_float_t *N[] = { n0, delta1.dir, delta2.dir};
00333       for(uint j = 0; j < 3; ++j){
00334         rv = corresponding_point(pt, V[j], V[(j+1) % 3], &d, cp);
00335         bool pos_was_updated = update_closest_pt(best_d, closest_pt, d, cp);
00336 
00337         // Need to think about how we wish to approach this and with what
00338         // accuracy
00339         // Compute normals -- try average for first 
00340   
00341         // if normals are more than 90 degrees off we may wish to drop
00342         // corresponding point -- for now we just assume closest point is best
00343         // and sum of normals will tell us otherwise
00344         if(pos_was_updated && best_N_dist && computed_N){
00345           my_float_t N_avg[3];
00346           std::copy(N[j], N[j] + 3, N_avg);
00347           my_axpy(3, 1.0, N[(j+1) % 3], 1, N_avg, 1);
00348           normalize(N_avg);
00349   
00350           // compute 1/2 L2 norm 
00351           *best_N_dist = 1 - dot(N_avg, N_in);
00352   
00353           std::copy(N_avg, N_avg + 3, computed_N);
00354         }
00355 
00356       }
00357     }
00358   }

00361 #if 0
00362   void
00363   compute_close_point(const my_float_t *pt, const my_float_t *v0,
00364                       const my_float_t *v1, const my_float_t *v2,
00365                       my_float_t *best_d, my_float_t *closest_pt) const
00366   {
00367     my_float_t d = my_float_max;
00368     my_float_t cp[3];
00369     std::fill(cp, cp+3, my_float_max);
00370 
00371     // Check if projection of pt to face plane is contained in the face
00372     bool rv = corresponding_point(pt, v0, v1, v2, &d, cp);
00373     if(rv) update_closest_pt(best_d, closest_pt, d, cp);
00374     else{
00375       const my_float_t *V[] = { v0, v1, v2 };
00376       for(uint j = 0; j < 3; ++j){
00377         rv = corresponding_point(pt, V[j], V[(j+1) % 3], &d, cp);
00378         update_closest_pt(best_d, closest_pt, d, cp);
00379       }
00380     }
00381   }
00382 
00383   inline void
00384   update_closest_pt(my_float_t *best_d, my_float_t *closest_pt,
00385                   const my_float_t d, const my_float_t *cp) const
00386   {
00387     my_float_t abs_d = (d < 0.0 ? -1.0 * d : d);
00388     my_float_t abs_saved_d = (*best_d < 0.0 ? -1.0 * (*best_d) : (*best_d));
00389     if(abs_d < abs_saved_d){
00390       *best_d = d;
00391       std::copy(cp, cp + 3, closest_pt);
00392     }
00393   }
00394 #endif
00395 
00396   void
00397   init_triangle_data_structure(const uint num_vert, const uint num_tri)
00398   {
00399     A_triangles_mess.reserve(num_vert);
00400     // Be generous and assume a soft max of 10 triangles per vertex
00401     dir_point_storage<two_thirds_triangle> tmp_store(20,3);
00402     for(uint i = 0; i < num_vert; ++i) A_triangles_mess.push_back(tmp_store);
00403     SimpleTrimeshTwo::init_triangle_data_structure(num_vert, num_tri);
00404   }
00405 
00406   void
00407   update_triangle_data_structure(const uint tri_idx, 
00408                                  const uint *vert_idz,
00409                                  const my_float_t **vertices, 
00410                                  const my_float_t **normals)
00411   {
00412     for(int j = 0; j < 3; ++j){
00413       two_thirds_triangle tmp;
00414       tmp.triangle_index = tri_idx;
00415 
00416       int next_j = (j + 1) % 3;
00417       std::copy(vertices[next_j], vertices[next_j] + 3, tmp.pos);
00418       std::copy(normals[next_j], normals[next_j] + 3, tmp.dir);
00419       A_triangles_mess[vert_idz[j] - 1].push_back(tmp);
00420 
00421       next_j = (j + 2) % 3;
00422       std::copy(vertices[next_j], vertices[next_j] + 3, tmp.pos);
00423       std::copy(normals[next_j], normals[next_j] + 3, tmp.dir);
00424       A_triangles_mess[vert_idz[j] - 1].push_back(tmp);
00425     }
00426     SimpleTrimeshTwo::update_triangle_data_structure(tri_idx, vert_idz,
00427                                                      vertices, normals);
00428   }

00431   DistanceArray A_grid;
00432   my_float_t A_max_pt2surf_dist;  
00433   std::vector< dir_point_storage<two_thirds_triangle> > A_triangles_mess;
